hasBalancedBrackets

public static boolean hasBalancedBrackets(java.lang.String input,
                                          boolean isFinal)
This method determines if the brackets are balanced or not. This is an alternative to using a stack.

Parameters:
input - String This is the input that it used to determine.
isFinal - boolean This is used to determine if it should be completely balanced or just logically valid so far. Ex: 5 (x + 3 is valid if you are not done typing.

hasRepeatedInvalidOperators

public static boolean hasRepeatedInvalidOperators(java.lang.String input)
The purpose of this method is to detect if there are redundant operations that are not possible. For instance, ++ or -- or x+ which is not possible.

Parameters:
input - This is the input command variable
Returns:
boolean This boolean informs if the input is valid or not.
